name: 吳建文
objective: The primary focus of the Computer Algorithm course is to enable students to use computers efficiently. This course teaches students how to design and analyze algorithms and how to apply algorithms to solve real world problems.
schedule:
Week 1: Introduction to computer algorithms
Week 2: The complexity of algorithms
Week 3: The greedy method
Week 4: The divide and conquer strategy
Week 5: The search strategies
Week 6: Prune and search
Week 7: Dyanmic programming
Week 8: Midterm
Week 9: NP-completeness
Week 10: Approximation algorithms
Week 11: Amortized analysis
Week 12: Randomized algorithms
Week 13: On-line algorithms
Week 14: Topics on discrete optimization
Week 15: Topics on existing NP-hard problems
Week 16: Paper readings
Week 17: Project presentation
Week 18: Final
materials:
1. Introduction to algorithms, 2nd edition, Cormen, T.H., Leiserson, C.E., Rivest, R.L., Stein, C., 2003, MIT press.
2. Introduction to desing and analysis of algorithms: a strategic approach, Lee, R.C.T., Tseng, S.S., Chang, R.C., Tsai, Y.T., 2005, Mc Graw Hill.
